intro: Psychotria nummularioides, commonly known as the "Mexican coffee plant," is a shrub native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of white to yellow flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded, moist environments. The plant is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
